Name: Receipt of rental assistance payments.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the receipt of rental assistance payments

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare

Summary: The bill would require the Human Resources Administration to provide landlords the option to accept rental assistance payments via an electronic transfer into a bank account.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Chapter 1 of title 21 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 21-145.3 to read as follows:
      � 21-145.3 Rental assistance payments. a. Definitions. For the purposes of this section, the term "rental assistance payments" means payments made by the department to landlords on behalf of tenants pursuant to programs administered by the department. 
      b. The department shall provide landlords the option to accept rental assistance payments via an electronic transfer into a bank account.
      � 2. This local law takes effect 90 days after it becomes law.
